intro: Hieracium dilutius, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators. The leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
